means: 警告( warn的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: President Castro has warned Cubans to prepare for a profound economic emergency.
sentence.Network_cn: 卡斯特罗主席已经提醒古巴人民为严重的经济危急状况做准备。

sentence.Network_en: Television broadcasters were warned to exercise caution over depicting scenes of violence.
sentence.Network_cn: 电视台受到警告，要求对暴力场面的描绘采取谨慎态度。

sentence.Network_en: Police warned motorists to allow extra time to get to work.
sentence.Network_cn: 警方告诫驾车者出门上班要留出富余时间。

PerfectNetExp.abs: you had warned him to use the ladder ., 你已经警告过他使用梯子.

general Motors and Chrysler will be into bankruptcy early next year if they do not present a government-appointed " car tsar " with viable restructuring plans , the White House warned today .白宫今天警告道：如果通用汽车和克莱斯勒未能给在政府指派的“汽车沙皇”提供一系列的重组计划的话，他们在明年早些时候将会破产。
They warned the problem is likely to get worse ., 他们还警告说 , 情况可能会变得更糟.
they warned me that it was a dangerous job ., 他们提醒过我这是一项危险的工作.

htaccess介绍和使用方法 - 站长之家 ... What Can I Do? 我该怎么做？ Warning 警告 Custom Error Pages 自定义错误页.

entry.def: If you warn someone about something such as a possible danger or problem, you tell them about it so that they are aware of it.

example.ex: When I had my first baby friends warned me that children were expensive...
example.tran: 当我有了第一个孩子时，朋友们提醒我说养孩子是很花钱的。

example.ex: They warned him of the dangers of sailing alone...
example.tran: 他们警告他说独自航行危险重重。

entry.def: If you warn someone not to do something, you advise them not to do it so that they can avoid possible danger or punishment.

example.ex: Mrs. Blount warned me not to interfere...
example.tran: 布朗特夫人警告我不要插手。

example.ex: Children must be warned to stay away from main roads...
example.tran: 必须警告孩子们远离交通要道。

entry.def: If someone says to you 'be warned', they are advising you to be cautious, because there are risks that you may not have thought about.

example.ex: But be warned: this is not a cheap option.
example.tran: 但要慎重：这个选择代价不菲。

auth_sentence.content: Be warned, you may cry tears of laughter.
auth_sentence.res_content: Be warned, you may cry tears of laughter.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Be warned, you may cry tears of laughter.

auth_sentence.content: Drivers are being warned not to pick up hitchhikers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Drivers are being warned not to pick up hitchhikers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Drivers are being warned not to pick up hitchhikers.

auth_sentence.content: Has anybody warned you about Eddie Jordan's shirts?
auth_sentence.res_content: Has anybody warned you about Eddie Jordan's shirts?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Has anybody warned you about Eddie Jordan's shirts?

Sentence.sentence: He added that he had warned Mclaughlin that three preventable accidents in one year could lead to his discharge,as indeed it should.
Tony Little, headmaster of Eton, warned that boys were being faded by the British education system because it had become too focused on girls.
People should be warned of its harmful consequences.
Friends and other veterans of the process have warned Meg that the back and forth between editing parent and writing student can be traumatic (痛苦的).
Marshall McLuhan, who came closer than most to seeing what was coming, warned.
Recently, the UK National Stem Cell Network warned the UK could lose its place among the world leaders in stem cell research unless adequate funding and legislation could be assured.
